I wouldn’t mind vice city. Bring back Lazlow though.

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

casey.:

Return to San Andreas would be awesome.

It would, I’ve heard some rumors about it (including some casting calls that are confirmed GTA related), but they may just be making a San Andreas Stories for PS Vita if anything. The main game would probably be set in Vice City or a new location altogether.

Read full topic

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“Rich, post:13, topic:400742”]Apparently been in development for years, still no announcement. Will probably be released late 2012 or early 2013.

Rockstar is tight-lipped as fuck so absolutely no details thus far either.[/quote]
Return to San Andreas would be awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:9, topic:400742”]Eh, I’ve seen games with Havok physics that were really bad in the physics department (cough The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion cough) I’ll watch the video now, although it looks nice.[/quote]The thing is, it’s what you do with the engine, a good engine gives you a head start, but if you fuck it up, even a good physics engine can’t make up for it.

Read full topic

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Eh, I’ve seen games with Havok physics that were really bad in the physics department (cough The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion cough) I’ll watch the video now, although it looks nice.

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I’m basing it from what I saw, I’m talking about the look etc. I don’t like killing people in such a realistic environment I guess

Read full topic

item.title: My new favorite GAME
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:400742”]I like the sandbox style sort of game, I’m not sure if I like how realistic it is…[/quote]I don’t think that will be a problem, they used the famous Havok Physics engine for the physics of their game (physics only), and as far as I know, Havok is in the leader of most realistic virtual world engines on earth.

Read full topic
